com.poesys.db.connection

Interface IConnectionFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JndiConnectionFactory, JndiMysqlConnectionFactory, JndiOracleConnectionFactory, JndiSybaseConnectionFactory, MySqlConnectionFactory, OracleConnectionFactory, PooledConnectionFactory, SybaseConnectionFactory

    public interface IConnectionFactory
    Interface for connection factory classes for database management systems; each class that supports this interface provides the appropriate setup and API use to get a single connection. The interface is an instance of the FactoryMethod design pattern.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IConnectionFactory.DBMS
      Enum type for the valid kinds of DBMS products the factory supports.

      Get a SQL connection from a DBMS to the default user on the default host using the default password.

      Get a SQL connection from a DBMS to the default user on the default host using a supplied password.

      Get the type of JDBC database this factory represents.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String password)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get a SQL connection from a DBMS to the default user on the default host using a supplied password. This permits storing the password separately from the rest of the DBMS parameters, such as in an encrypted wallet, or even prompting the user for it.
        Parameters:
        password - The user-entered password for the user
        Returns:
        the JDBC connection to the user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem getting a connection

      • getConnection

        java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get a SQL connection from a DBMS to the default user on the default host using the default password.
        Returns:
        the JDBC connection to the user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem getting a connection

        Set the current user to which to connect
        Parameters:

      • setHost

        void setHost(java.lang.String host)
        Set the current host to which to connect
        Parameters:

      • setPort

        void setPort(java.lang.Integer port)
        Set the current port on the host to which to connect
        Parameters:
        port - the port to which to connect on the host

      • setPassword

        void setPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Set the JDBC driver password for the connection
        Parameters:
        password - the database password to use for the connection

      • setDatabase

        void setDatabase(java.lang.String database)
        Set the JDBC database (or the JNDI name) for the connection
        Parameters:
        database - the database name for the connection

      • getDbms

        IConnectionFactory.DBMS getDbms()
        Get the type of JDBC database this factory represents.
        Returns:
        a DBMS type

      • flush

        void flush()
    throws ConnectionException
        Flush any cached data to allow complete reinitialization of the factory.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - when there is a problem initializing or getting connections

      • close

        void close()
    throws ConnectionException
        Close the data source.
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - when there is a problem closing the connection
